title: Inscription recording an architect called Proxenos
support:
A block originally from the border of an ancient road, regular in front but
                                        angular on the reverse. Subsequently reused and cut along the lower edge and
                                        some damage to the right side.

layout.p:
Four lines of Greek letters filling the surviving face, with a regular left
                                        margin, uneven right margin

handNote.lettering:
Deep, square cut, regular letters showing features of both middle and later
                                    Hellenistic texts: alpha with broken bar; mu and sigma with parallel bars; pi with
                                    equal vertical strokes; omega closed as circle on the horizontal bar in line 3,
                                    above the bar in line 1; episoli and xsi with short middle bar; omicron smaller and
                                    above the line.

provenanceObserved._:
Identified following earlier excavations (prior to 1992) of a section
                            of ancient road on the north-west slopes of Pizzo S. Angelo on Monte Riparato. Now on display in the museum.

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo 2017-09-05

keywords: inscription recording an architect called proxenos
